name: uncalibrated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An uncalibrated measuring instrument or other device has not had the controls checked or changed to make sure it is accurate: The touchpad is still uncalibrated and doesn't provide the pressure sensitive functions.
Uncalibrated numbers, dates, or other information are in the form they were collected and have not been changed to make them more accurate or standard: All the radiocarbon dates are given as conventional, uncalibrated ages.
More examplesFewer examplesFew people need exact colour reproduction on their desktop, and most use their displays in uncalibrated RGB mode.As the radar was uncalibrated, the size of the targets could not be determined exactly.The sample yielded an uncalibrated radiocarbon age of 1,700 ± 60 years.Therefore, it was not justified to use uncalibrated pH measurements for determination of the pKₐ values of soluble acids.
